title: FylloClip tutorial
text:
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: Introduction
text: This tutorial is intended to provide all the necessary information for building a fully functional FylloClip module capable of transmitting data remotely via the LoRaWAN network. It will guide you from ordering PCBs (printed circuit boards), buying electronic components, assembly of the system and programming to setting up the remote data transmission.

title: list of components
text: here follows a list of all the required electronic components:

title: PCBs
text:
Here you can download the production files for the PCB needed to create the control unit (Arduino board) as well as the PCBs used as foliar sensors.
The files are provided in two different formats, gerber and EasyEDA. The gerber files can be used directly to place an order with a PCB manufacturer, whereas the EasyEDA files can be uploaded to the EasyEDA PCB design software where they can be edited and modified before placing an order.

Arduino board



Arduino board PCB


Gerber format
EasyEDA format


FylloClip sensors
When ordering the foliar sensors, please make sure to select a PCB thickness of 1 mm. If the thickness is more than 1 mm, the sensor will be too stiff an difficult to be placed on a leaf. I have always chosen the white colour, but probably it does not make much of a difference if you choose another colour.
